name: Nolan Clagg
text: These guys were absolutely incredible. Very fast and efficient. Super friendly. Can handle big items like nothing. Would 100% use them again!

name: Caroline Bundy
text: Our move was absolutely seamless thanks to our four guys! All four had a can-do attitude and great senses of humor! I highly recommend All My Sons!

name: Thomes Stewart
text: Let’s start at the beginning! The men showed up with no TOOLS! I was being charged $175 per hour and they showed up with no tools. Then when they came back they took forever! I moved 5 minutes down the street out of a two bedroom townhouse to a 2 bedroom apartment and it took 4 hours with three men! I was charged $895 to move 5 minutes up the road with only two beds, couch, washer dryer, chest drawer, desk and deep freezer. I moved majority of the my personal belongings on my own so it shouldn’t have taken that long! They also installed my bed incorrect now my $2200 kings size bed is on the floor because the panel on the side is split in half because it was set up properly.

name: daniel smith
text:
Was told they would send two trucks, sent one and jammed most of a 2400 square foot house into it.  Paid for a full pack, and the jokers who showed up didn't even know they were supposed to pack it up.  Were three hours late, so they were late leaving out and caused us to use a vacation day bc we had to overnight at the destination.  Broke my king bed and big screen TV.  Tried to hide the broken bed; didn't find out about the TV until we plugged it in. Scuffed a bunch more of our wooden furniture.  Soaked a queen mattress...who knows how?  Now has stains and mold on it.
Was told by "Brad" that we'd be compensated for the stuff they destroyed.  No dice.  Tried to get the reimbursement claim, but didn't even get one sent to us.  They left a quarter of our stuff still in the old house the day before the house had a final walkthrough before sell date.  Had to send the second truck (was told two trucks from the start!), and one of the guys they sent sassed me when I asked him if he would wrap some loose items.  Asked for a tip after they busted our stuff.  Tried to call Brad multiple times without answers or recompense.  Stay away.  Would give negative stars if I could.

name: jill garrett
text: I had a great experience with all my sons. They were very courteous and really listened to my needs. I highly recommend them. Ask for Nate. He’s a beast. Very fast yet respectful and mindful of moving your items.

name: Garren Simms
text: Packed and moved my parents. Crew was so nice ! Will use again in future

All My Sons Moving & Storage

Good Job All My Sons!!!

text: My experience with this company was very positive. They were on time, professional, friendly and had a good attitude and the cost was reasonable. I would use them again. I recommend this company for your moving needs.

text: Imani and Chris were amazing. They were prompt, efficient and very careful. They were very polite young men.

resp.text: Hi, Jennifer. We appreciate the kind words and are glad we could provide you with a positive experience!

name: Anna Winingham
text: Very responsive and professional. We had a great experience with this long distance move. The price I was quoted was exactly what was owed in the end!

name: Michelle Davis
text: We have used All My Sons twice in the past 3 weeks. Everyone was very helpful and professional. Josh, Quinton, Jerome (and 3 more guys whose names I can’t remember - so sorry) worked very hard and efficiently which I really appreciated since they charge by the hour. I would definitely recommend them!

name: Michael Hubbard
text: Wonderful job!  All My Sons Moving was on time, professional, and focused. We will use them again. Thank you.

name: Kylee Tinney
text:
The All My Sons Pelham office should be AVOIDED AT ALL COSTS. I have never written a negative Yelp/Google review, BUT I have also never been treated so poorly (thank you Nate) as a paying customer of a business. We booked with All My Sons for our Saturday move a few weeks in advance. My husband spoke to MULTIPLE different reps, male and females, confirming that movers would be at our house at 8:00am. On the day of our move, we got a call saying, “the crew never showed up” and they were going to be late. 9:00am rolls around, and we get another call saying they won’t be there until 9:45am. Frustrated that we have now lost 2 hours of moving time (moves are already high-stress to begin with without the added frustration of movers not showing), I call the office to express my concerns. Enter the ever-so-lovely “Nate”, who I HOPE does not have a “Manager” title to his name. If so, you should seriously reconsider. Argumentative, rude, arrogant…the list goes on. Nate probably needs a refresher in Customer Service 101, “the customer is always right”. Nate tells me that their moves start from “8-10am”, so “technically” they weren’t late and “no one would have told us they were going to be there by 8am”. I explained that we spoke with MULTIPLE people and that was not the case….we were assured they would be there at 8am. After a few LOVELY back and forths with this Nate character, he says, “Alright, I’m cancelling your move and you can find someone else.”
*Click*
He hangs up the phone. If you are the owner of All My Sons, please know that you have someone representing your business in the POOREST way. I have already submitted a complaint to the BBB. This business needs to be INVESTIGATED and management needs to be reevaluated. My experience is NO WAY to treat a paying customer. Cancelling someone’s day-of service because they receive a VALID complaint is beyond me and I hope there are repercussions for Nate treating people the way he does. Based on Google/Yelp reviews, this is not an isolated incident.  Luckily, the bright spot in the day was calling MOVEDADDY who completely rearranged their moving schedule to accommodate us and did so with the most POSITIVE attitude. And they were $50+ less expensive/hour. SO all-in-all crisis averted in doing business with All My Sons, and I’m glad they did not get a PENNY of my money. What a joke.

resp.text:
Hello Kylee, I would like the opportunity to speak with you about the experience that you had with us. If you could please give me a call or send me an email, so we can set up a time to discuss your move in further detail.

Corena Edens
Customer Relations Manager
All My Sons Business Development, LLC
Office: 469-461-5000 Ext. 1070
Email: cedens@allmysons.com

name: Katy Williams
text: Joshua E, Jerome K, and Quinton W were the best! They worked very quickly and efficiently, and they were courteous and polite throughout the day. They made the process simple and easy! We will definitely recommend All My Sons to others!

name: Kamesha Hawkins
text: 1st move went smoothly. 2nd move was horrible. Moving crew was an hour and a half late arriving. One of the three crew members was very rude, unprofessional, using profanities. He was complaining about the amount of stuff that was to be moved. Just all around nasty attitude the whole move. Other two guys were very pleasant and mannerable. Nate was totally nonchalant about team being late and would not budge on price for the inconvenience to me. As a returning customer, I would not recommend.

name: Megan Rose
text: Hannah was great! I did not end up using them for services, but Hannah was thorough and very friendly. She kept communication, checking in with me via email and phone, to see if I had decided about services. She was not annoying or bothersome with her communication. I would definitely recommend them just based off the interaction I had with Hannah.

resp.text: Megan We are so happy to hear that!

name: Alyssa White
text: This was an excellent company to work for by far the best value for the service don't waste your time calling or on all the other moving company is go with these guys

resp.text: Hi, Alyssa. Thank you so much for leaving us a stellar review!

name: Zack Randall
text: If you go with another moving company, you are missing out. From the first call to the end of the move these guys were pleasant to work with. I’ll never use another company.

name: Sarah Winstead
text: Movers were wonderful. Office was really kind and informative. Will definitely book with all my son's in the future if I should move again.

name: Robert Gardner
text: Movers showed up on time and were very efficient. The reason for giving there Stars came in to play at our new house. One of the movers hit the wall going into our bedroom and scuffed our freshly painted walls and didn't say a word to us. I called the office and told them what happened and the gentleman told me we could file a claim. After we paid for the move and even tipped the guys $100 each, still no word on the wall damage, not even from the office.

name: Katie Foster
text: They were the best! Made everything so easy. Thank you guys!

name: Sarah Frames
text: Brad the manager and the movers were amazing. Will recommend all my sons to my family and friends for their moves!

name: amanda ostaszewski
text: Garrett, Will, and ...Caleb (not sure I got his name right, sorry) were professional and I would recommend hiring them for your move!

name: Dinetta Jones
text: The movers that helped with my move were extremely respectful, worked very diligently, & I definitely would hire this crew again!

name: Taylor Seymour
text: The crew were very careful with our belongings and efficient with the time! Great experience with them!

name: Kelsea Nassif
text: INCREDIBLE experience. Very polite, very quick, and exactly the price I expected to spend. I didn’t have to do a thing! They brought padding, tape, and shrink wrap and took great care of all my things. Very thankful for Justin and his partner! Couldn’t have done it without them. Thanks, guys!

name: Jimmy Lauderdale
text:
Daughter recommended them after a move. Talked to several movers before deciding on AMS. In house estimator was on time and thorough. We walked down the move and discussed site conditions and options to overcome any challenges (mainly very steep and long drive). AMS still had the best price.
On the day of the move, Josh and the guys were right on time. Unfortunately for them, the drive was so steep that the truck bound against the concrete even when empty. They parked the truck on the road and came in to walk down the move.
The guys really needed a smaller truck to shuttle things down a long steep drive. After talking among themselves, they determined the move had to take place and promptly began to wrap and carry things to the truck parked on the street.
An hour into the move came the 560# gun safe which they gang tackled and rolled with the aid of only a set of hand trucks. It wasn’t easy. But, the task was completed without incident.
These guys were great!
The delivery was much easier and just as professional.
This was the first of a two part move. They will be doing the next move as well. Hopefully with a truck that can handle the driveway.

name: Santana T.
text: JAY WAS AWESOME HE CALLED ME VERY PROFESSIONAL WHEN WE TALKED ON THE PHONE THEY WAS ON TIME ALL AROUND GREAT......

resp.text: Hi, Santana. Thank you so much for leaving us a stellar review!

name: Ritu Parr
text: This was the most pleasant moving experiences I’ve had. They went above and beyond to take care of us.

name: Kelsea Nassif
text: INCREDIBLE experience. Very polite, very quick, and exactly the price I expected to spend. I didn’t have to do a thing! They brought padding, tape, and shrink wrap and took great care of all my things. Very thankful for Justin and his partner! Couldn’t have done it without them. Thanks, guys!

name: John Godfrey
text: Guys were awesome. Everything went smooth and cost less than I thought it would since they got it all done in a timely manner. Will definitely use All My Sons again and recommend it to my family and friends.

name: Eric Baxley
text: Made a short move across town this morning with the help of All My Sons. The guys were very hard working and got right to work. Very pleased with their effort and professionalism.

name: Amanda Hilliard
text: All My Sons did a great job for our move on 11/23! Quick and fast, and they showed up earlier than expected which was awesome! They had a 3 man crew and extremely efficient! Will you use them again!

name: Lisa Hall
text: The 2 young men who moved us today were so good and very nice! They called right on time this morning and didn’t waste time. This is the 2nd time we’ve used AMS Moving and will definitely use again when we’re ready to move these things out of storage. Cheers to a job well done! Thank you.

name: Hannah C
text: I’m giving them two stars because the actual movers themselves were nice, once they actually arrived. I was supposed to move at around 8 or 9 in the morning and they didn’t show up at my house until 1:30 pm. The manager claimed that one of their truck’s battery had died and they had to wait until another truck was available. I understand these issues happen, but it is extremely inconvenient that they called about this 15 minutes before they were supposed to arrive. I had no other day to move as I had to work at 7 am the next morning. The manager could not give us an exact time for when the movers would arrive, just that they would be arriving some time that day. The person we talked to on the phone was condescending, saying that they’ve been doing this “for 20 years” and that “they’d handle this situation” while refusing to give us an estimated time of when the movers would be here. At one point, we’d try to call and they wouldn’t even answer the phone. I didn’t have time to wait around for them to show up. I guess I’m surprised and grateful they showed up at all, given the other poor reviews about this moving company. It sounds like they have serious management issues. I will never be using this company again.

name: Ambria Hardy
text:
Paid deposit on my 8-9 am deposit, but didn’t get a truck at my house until after noon. Local office was very apathetic.
Not a great experience, should’ve used Uhaul.

Also NOT COVID friendly. They preach about this on their site, but movers came up wearing no masks unlike the ones in the pictures on the website.

name: Jonathan Edwards
text: Great customer service and movers. Will  use all my sons again

resp.text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!

Thank you!

name: Joanie Bernard
text: This moving company delivered everything they promised! Two young guys arrived in their large, clean truck and immediately started to move our stuff to the truck. These guys NEVER STOPPED! Up and down the stairs they went, each lifting heavy things alone, and seriously, never. stopped. Our belongings were unloaded in the same quick manner, by the very polite guys. I would recommend this company to anyone looking for a great price and great service.

resp.text:
Joanie, our 5 Star Review means so much to our Birmingham team.  Thank you very much for taking the time out to post our review and to let us know that we were able to provide you with the type of service that we pride ourselves on.

Have a wonderful rest of your day.

Corena Edens - Customer Relations

name: Hannah C
text: I’m giving them two stars because the actual movers themselves were nice, once they actually arrived. I was supposed to move at around 8 or 9 in the morning and they didn’t show up at my house until 1:30 pm. The manager claimed that one of their truck’s battery had died and they had to wait until another truck was available. I understand these issues happen, but it is extremely inconvenient that they called about this 15 minutes before they were supposed to arrive. I had no other day to move as I had to work at 7 am the next morning. The manager could not give us an exact time for when the movers would arrive, just that they would be arriving some time that day. The person we talked to on the phone was condescending, saying that they’ve been doing this “for 20 years” and that “they’d handle this situation” while refusing to give us an estimated time of when the movers would be here. At one point, we’d try to call and they wouldn’t even answer the phone. I didn’t have time to wait around for them to show up. I guess I’m surprised and grateful they showed up at all, given the other poor reviews about this moving company. It sounds like they have serious management issues. I will never be using this company again.

name: Ritika Ramchandani
text: My friend hired these movers to move only furniture and 4 boxes from an apartment to her home 45 minutes away. They were 4 hours late, said it was because they accidentally went to the house instead of the apartment, then said they broke down on the way. Come to find out, they were busy working on another job and broke down in the Hoover area. *no transparency!* why lie?? The movers were nice but did mention “wanting to go home” which is unprofessional in my opinion. THE KICKER IS THAT THEY DROVE THE TRUCK THROUGH THEIR LAWN *forcing them to have to file an unnecessary insurance claim* THIS IS AFTER SHE GAVE THEM instructions on how to properly get onto the driveway, that they failed to follow. What should’ve been 8 a.m.-12:30 p.m. ended up being 1 p.m.-7p.m. I would recommend Moving On Birmingham LLC! Great company that moved me in and out of my last place! Moving is stressful; you shouldn’t pay over $1,000 for it to be MORE stressful!

name: Lyndsey Basinger
text: These have to be the most unprofessional people I’ve ever dealt with. I’m shocked they’re still in business.

name: Ashley Price
text: Very poor service.  I had brand new furniture and the 2 men scratched everything and drug my couch down the stairs and put holes all in it. This was 8 months ago and still nothing to resolve the issue. I would never recommend this company.

name: Dawn
text: I had 3 large trucks and 6 men lined up to move me to another house 6 miles away.  It took them all day and they ended up just tossing some of my furniture and most of my boxed glass and breakable  items into my detached garage at the end of the day.  Move was 6 months ago and I still don't have the heart to unpack all the items in my garage because I find broken pieces every time I do.  The "manager" was nice but some of the other men were impossible to work with.  When they drove off, one of the trucks accidentally pulled our telephone wire off the house.  Needless to say, I would never call these folks to move me again.

If you would have done so at the time of the incident, I know we would have gotten you taken care of then.  Please give me a call or send me an email so we can set up a time to discuss this in further detail.

Corena Edens
Customer Relations Manager

Awsome company fallow up call were great!

Hard workers,very polite.

text: These guys were AMAZING!!! I called Monday, they moved me Tuesday and were priced so perfectly!!!! If I move again I will forever use this company!!

name: David Alexander
text:
Horrible! Don't believe the sales pitch when they come out to do a quote.

-showed up late morning of move
-the older guy in charge of the crew spent the whole time complaining about how the other three weren't doing a good job but never did anything to correct it
-were suppose to send three movers to unload at destination, only sent two
-we just replaced the hardwoods, which they knew, and were suppose to do "full protection" on the house. The full protection stuff somehow did not make it onto the truck
-they took about their make shift floor protection towards the end of the move, before they were done with the dolly's, and scratched our new hardwood floors
-tried to overcharge me on the unload since it took the two guys a lot longer than was quoted (they were suppose to send three), and I had to be the one to catch that and say no I'm not paying more than the quote. Then their manager acted like they were doing me a favor by giving me some discount on the labor.

Overall, awful experience, stay away, don't believe their sales pitch. I'm not sure if other moving companies are any better, but they can't be worse

name: Nala Evans
text: I have used All My Sons twice. The first time was for a local move and it was perfect. I decided to use them again for an out of state move because they were the cheapest for the long distance. My two movers were great with getting me packed up and got to my location in a timely fashion. However, I noticed that they left a few items. I dismissed it as an oversight. However, I noticed several dents and dings in my belongings at drop off. I also noticed that some of my items were never delivered after they left. All My Sons promises to disassemble and reassemble whatever is needed, but my movers refused to put together my dining table. After a phone call to the HQ, they gave a meager attempt to put it together but then stopped because they “didn’t know how to put it together”. I paid over $1000 for poor service and called to give feedback. I was promised a callback by a manager within 20 minutes and no one ever answered. If you can spare the extra funds, please use a different mover for long distance. I was also charged an extra $100 until I caught the error.

resp.text: Hi Nala, thank you for leaving your feedback. We regret to hear that you did not have a positive moving experience with us. It appears that you have not yet contacted our customer care team. Please reach out to us at 866-941-1849 so we can begin the claims process. If you have questions about your final bill, please reach out to us at the local office so we can assist you. (205) 591-7002

text: We had a great experience with All My Sons. Would definitely recommend!

name: Steven Puckett
text: Use a reputable company.  These guys were useless.  Yes, we have a steep driveway, and yes, for 2 weeks we reminded them that they needed a high back truck.  Did they listen?  Nope.  They showed up with the wrong trucks, look at it, decide they need a different truck and leave.  Then they show up the NEXT day, again with the wrong trucks, THEN they decide nope, can't do it....and leave...  We are out vacation time, and now have to schedule with (hopefully) a REAL company that knows what they are doing...more than a week out!  Thanks guys!  We really appreciated it!

text: Josh and crew did amazing. Will recommend to family and friends moving in the future.

name: Andrea Childress
text: NEVER AGAIN! This company took 10 hours to complete a very simple move. I was left with several broken items and have been unable to locate my candelabras. The job started with three movers at the 6 hour mark, they sent an additional man. The movers came unprepared (no tools to remove the washing machine) and to top it all off after wasting 7 hours the “boss’s” son refused to move the washing machine. I had to call the office before they finally agreed to put my perfectly fine washing machine on the truck. Toward the end of my hellish experience with this unprofessional company, I asked the movers to move a piece a furniture and they agreed claiming they had to run to the truck to grab something. After a long wait, I went to check on them only to see them pulling out of my driveway. Long story short... I was out of $1200 after being quoted $700. Save yourself the aggravation and money, GO WITH SOMEONE ELSE!!!

name: Tamesha Turner
text: All my Sons is the most reliable movers I have ever dealt with. They arrived at 8a and was done by 10:45a. Collin, Zack, and Joe (I really hope I got his name right) were very funny and I am looking forward to working with these guys again. I had to move out my apartment very quickly and the stress that I had up until Friday was gone. I would recommend All my Sons for your moving needs. Fast, friendly, and reliable with great prices.

name: Eryk Johnson
text: I'll give them 1 star for all the current reviews being 1 star reviews. The workplace is toxic. They treat their good helpers and movers like they're easily replaceable. They can't keep good workers because of this. The manager also forms favorites and knows what she's doing when she distributes out certain jobs to workers. I use to work for this company but after all I've seen I wouldn't call all my son's to help move your family. I've had dear friends use this company also and they'd complain about all the smoke breaks and mostly would complain about communication with the management. I use to tell customers all the time that we can only help the moving end of things and that we, the movers, can't help that All My Sons overcharges for material. I've seen so much circus acts at all my son's. The workers getting in fist fights and even taking it across the street. They run their business like a drama soap opera. Not to mention the management forming favorites and even having affairs with employees. Theirs also "gang" members that work here and they keep it all in the family. When I worked for all my son's my best friend was going to use them and I told him to ask for me and my dad (my "dad" works there what I mean by "keeping it all in the family") and when my friend couldn't get me to cover his job because of unknown reasons I told him to just use another moving company because you will be disappointed and better off moving your own things or calling another company that cares. All my son's doesn't care about a good portion of jobs because the workers have 2 0r 3 jobs a day and they either hurry up and damage things or they milk the clock and overcharge on materials. Sue me but it's the truth. Could say more but I'm not.

name: patricia persons
text: This company is a rip off!! I moved from my daughter's home to an apartment;no more than 8-10 miles. The movers took shelves out of a bookcase and now the shelves cannot be found. One of the movers Trey seemed out of it. He was extremely lazy. He loaded a table from outside that I didn't want. The items in my drawers were all over the place. I was originally told it would be 90.00 per hr. Ended up at 99.00. Management is uncaring. Prices are made up as they go along. This company is the worst. I am out 500.00 and the shelves from my bookcase. These con men need to be investigated!!! Never ever again!!! Don't waste your time and money.

In 2013, we used AMS moving. It was the worst experience. I have the emails to/from them to prove it. They offered us a "settlement" as long as we wouldn't say anything bad about them. We didn't take it.
Many of the same claims match ours. I totally believe they're scamming clients.
If you need proof, I'll be happy to email it to you.
Avoid them, at all costs.

name: Lewis Gaines
text: That’s how moving should be done. I couldn’t have did better myself

name: Ryan Staniscavage
text:
We have moved several times because of my job and this one was the worst experience.  This time, this was a local move.  It was an easy move for the movers as well.  I had already taken most of our things, but I hired All My Sons to move a few dressers, an fridge, washer, dryer, and a couple of game tables.  We also had a large piece of furniture in storage.  But, they didn't have to move beds, clothes, dishes, etc.  The move should have taken about 2-3 hours.

My move was scheduled to start at 8am.  At 7:45am, I received a call that due to DOT requirements, the driver could not arrive until 10-10:30am.  I get it.  I work with DOT every day.  But this was poor scheduling and the last-minute notice wasn't pleasing, but I was willing to let it slide.  But the driver did not arrive until 11:45am.  I had an important appointment at 2pm that day.  I told the driver we needed to get moving.  He replied saying his boss called him at 10am wanting to know if he could work.  Now, I finally know the truth.

At first, the guys were moving well.  They loaded up the house in about 35 minutes.  I was pleased.  Then we dropped by our storage unit and the driver was more interested in looking at our pictures or checking out our motorized toys.  At this point, I knew he was dragging his feet and running up the clock.  They finished the move in about 4.5-5 hours.  We were moving to a new home that we built.  They scratched the staircase in two places pretty severely.

I spoke to the supervisor and told him about my complaints.  He asked me what I was looking for.  I told him I would leave the resolution up to him, but I knew if I ran my business with this type of communication and lack of urgency, I would lose my customers.  He responded, "Well, you were moved today and the guys have to get paid."  So, I paid, but I promised myself I would leave reviews everywhere I could.  I was completely disappointed.

The response below seems to be the same cut and paste response issued by All My Sons to every negative review.  I gave All My Sons the opportunity to make the transaction right over the phone.  I told them I would leave the remedy up to them and the response I got was, "You got moved today and the guys have to be paid."

resp.text: Hi Ryan, thank you for leaving your feedback. We regret to hear that you did not have a positive moving experience with us. We understand your frustration that you’re having regarding the scheduling issue and the items that were damaged during the moving process and we hope to help you address this concern. It appears that you have not yet contacted our customer care team. Please reach out to us at (866) 941-1849 so we can begin the claims process. If you have questions about your final bill, please reach out to us at the local office so we can assist you. (205) 591-7002

text: In 2014, I had them help me move from an apartment to a house.  Everything was going well.  They moved fast and were nice guys. On the way to the new house,  I decided that I would go get a couple boxes of doughnuts and treat the guys. My husband headed to the new house. When I arrived,  I expected to see the guys there already. They didnt show up for TWO HOURS. We only moved 14 miles.  My husband, and I were just at the house waiting. They said they were stuck in traffic on the interstate.  My husband went back to the apartment and all they way back to the new house using various routes. To this day,  we don't know where they actually were.  It ended up costing several hundred dollars more for "travel time."  We chose them because they had the best rates,  but that was a mistake.  We are getting ready to move again,  but I will never use them again. The thought still upsets me.

text:
DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY! My mom paid them a deposit and also minimum 3 hours rather they are there for 1 hour or 3 hours when they come out and they ONLY MOVE 2 items and the 2 items that they moved for her ended up costing her more money to fix what they tore up! I am very upset over this and not only bc of them doing my mom this way but also bc she called to let the person in charge know about it and they had the nerve to tell her she should not have been so rude to them! I’m sorry but asking them to please be careful bc they had already cost her money by having to fix what they tore up is not rude!
Then the 2 boys that came out cussed at my mother! She even let that person know about the mouth they had and still blamed my mother! My mother requested her money back and the man had the nerve to tell her that she will not get it and there is nothing she can do about it!
I don’t know about y’all but this is not how you run a business!
I have noticed that this company does not put the negative ratings on them that I googled and found! So with this being said, I will let you decide on if you really want to throw your money away by handing it over to this so called company! name: Greg Smith
text: This move was for my daughter and it was terrible from the initial first call to the last piece of furniture coming off truck. We were told 8-9 am but when it reached 8:30 we called local office and spoke to someone named Chris. He sounded very rude on the phone. Apparently had a few issues that morning delaying crew getting to our house. So they finally arrived later in morning. Everything was off to ok start until I noticed a lot of cursing going on that was upsetting. I asked them to please tone it down and be professional. That just pissed them off even more to the point they were being very careless with the furniture. The manager Chris was calling crew throughout day over and over and over yelling and screaming at top of his lungs to where I could hear every word from across the room in kitchen. I asked what was that? And crew said oh he's always like that. So now crew is trying to rush and throw everything on truck on top of already not doing a great job. One of the crewmen even made the comment we are way overworked and underpaid and management is horrible. Needless to say we have a lot of damage, the movers hate management and their jobs, and we had to pay for a horrible move. I spoke with friends afterward who encountered a lot of these same issues. Even had same issue with managers calling a ridiculous number of times. Get these people out of business as this seems to be a reoccurring issue. I will also be following up with BBB and stopping payment on my credit card.

resp.text: Hi Greg, we're very sorry to hear about this experience. We expect our crews to act very professionally when they're out working on a move. It seems to me that was not the case with your move so we understand your frustration. We take this feedback very seriously and will use it to ensure that nothing of this nature happens again in the future. If you are still needing assistance with any items that were damaged during the move, please reach out to us so we can help you resolve it. (866) 941-1883

name: JACQUELINE SOMMERVILLE
text:
What ever you do, PLEASE, PLEASE do not use this company!!!!!  Very unprofessional, unethical and plain rude!!!!!  I WISH I HAD READ PREVIOUS REVIEWS BEFORE I SCHEDULED A MOVE!  AAANND I WISH I COULD RATE THEM A ZERO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I called several weeks in advance to schedule a moving date. The customer service was awesome! I even called back several other times to verify some other information.  NEVER  IN ANY OF THOSE CONVERSATIONS WAS I GIVEN DIRECTIONS HOW TO SET UP MY HOUSE FOR MY MOVE!!!
Saturday, April 13,  2019  the movers arrived. They walked through then had me to sign some papers. They begin to move a few things. The heavier set gentleman was on the phone. Still no moving going on! The next thing I know a lady shows up , introduces herself and said she was doing a walk through. I said okay. She walked my town house and stated to me that I need to clean my dresser off. There was some sticky residue on there. I said okay and cleaned the dresser.  I went back to sit down. I noticed they had packed my TV and I needed it because Direct TV was headed to the new location. My friend was coming to pick it up the TV.  I went to the truck to get the TV. The manger and the heavier set guy were behind the truck smoking cigarettes. So I asked,  "Were we moving anything today." "You all are on a smoke break and nothing has been moved!" She said , no ma'am.  We are getting ready to move you. "I suppose what I said led to what happened next"  She sent  the African American guy into my town house to let me know they had to CANCELED my move today.  I guess because I was African American that was the reason for sending him. He had no explanation. I asked since she was the manger why didn't she come and tell me what the problem was and why my move was canceled.  He said she a White lady. In other words, he was sent to do the dirty work! By this time I am furious! I call the office and some gentleman couldn't really explain either. He just said it was cancelled. I used some unprofessional words and hung the phone up. I called back to speak to her and she stated that there was no room for their dollies to pass through, there was an odor and it was not clean. All of those were lies! I don't know any place that will be clean when you are moving.  I had all of my boxes and bags in one  location. They were labeled and separated.  The only items upstairs were the bedrooms. I used some more unprofessional , choice words again! My issue with the entire thing is NO ONE explained to me how to set up for the move or came our prior for a walk through. SHE told me that was COMMON SENSE! I gave some more unprofessional , choice words.  I live in a town house which does not have a lot of room. I can not help how many items I had. I did contact corporate office and explained EVERYTHING! I even expressed that I used unprofessional words and I did apologize to the corporate office.  Thank God I have awesome family and friends!!! They moved me with no hesitation and never complained. What about the people who don't have family and friends in the city!  Treat people how you want to be treated!  KARMA is for real!!!!  SO WHO EVER READS THIS DON'T EVER USE THESE RUDE AND UNPROFESSIONAL, SMOKE BREAK PEOPLE IF YOU CAN HELP IT!!!!! UGGGH!!!!!!

name: Krissy Bailey
text: If I could give All My Sons, more than 5 stars, I would!  I have use movers several times before, and never before have I received the level of service that I experienced throughout the entire process of this move. Scheduling my moving day and receiving my quote took no time at all, and I was shocked at the affordability off the bat! The pricing is super straight forward, and the  is charged by a flat by the hour fee, with no hidden costs - it made it easy to help budget. I then received a follow up call from the local team that would be handling my move, personally introducing themselves and making sure I didn't have any additional questions.  However, the move day itself is actually what floored me... this was no easy move, I was downsizing my parents from a 4 bedroom house with a basement full of stuff to a two bedroom apartment - so the move involved a LOT of stuff and several stops (between storage and the new place).  Quinton (the driver) and his team (Quinteze, Jamaul and Colin) showed up right on time, moved quickly and efficiently, and never once acted like anything was a problem! They really went above and beyond, even taking items that we planned to give away down to the basement for us. These four guys were so nice and helpful, and really made what was a tough and challenging move for me, seem easy!  I cannot recommend this team and the company high enough - I will use them for ANY move I plan in the future. Thank you to All My Sons, and especially to Quinton, Quinteze, Jamaul and Colin!

name: Brian Naugle
text: My wife and I needed help moving on short notice and All My Son's was able to to accommodate our request which was good to hear. Which chose to hire movers because we just completed renovations and wanted to avoid causing damage to our newly renovated house. They told my wife they had an early morning opening and a late morning opening. We chose the later option because of our work schedules. They showed up an hour earlier than we expected and we were not prepared. The staff was nice  and they did not waste anytime getting loaded. When I arrived to the house my wife was disappointed. When we called AMS to arrange the move we asked them if they could assemble some items. My wife was told they disassembled and assembled. When my wife showed the men the items she was told her they would only assemble what they had previously disassembled at the pickup. It might have been a misunderstanding on our end, but I'm not sure why it would be a problem since they charge by the hour. The most disappointing part was the damages caused to our house. We know these men are working hard and furniture can be difficult to move through hallways and doors so we expected minor scratches/dents might  occur, but in two places the damage was beyond what I would call minor. The casing on the front door and one of the hallways has chunks of wood taken out of them.  While we still would have been annoyed.. If we had we been notified during the move we would have let it go. Nobody said anything about the damages and now we will have to make repairs to work that was just completed. Nice people to work with, but they need to work with their staff on communication to their clients and honesty.

resp.text: Brian, Thank you for your valuable feedback, we are sorry we did not meet your expectation on your relocation with us. Please contact our customer care team at 866-941-1849. Best Regards, All My Sons

name: Travis Ackermann
text: Crazy EXPENSIVE

name: L
text:
I scheduled my move on May 10th for May 28th. I was told I would receive a call 24-48 hrs before the move to comfirm time. I did not. I contacted them less than 24 hrs before our scheduled move only to be told they over booked and if it was ok, would I be willing to moved the day back one day. So I agreed since they offered to lower the rate and make me the firts appointment of that day. So Monday came. I was told they would be there between 8:30a and 9:30a. I'm almost 3 months pregnant & I feel asleep about 9am. I woke up around 11am. No movers!!! My husband said they called at 10:48a saying they were behind and several workers called out. 8 to be excat. This is one of the reasons I originally scheduled my move for that Sunday--the day before the Holiday (Memorial Day). My husband was told they would be there in a few hours. A few hours passed, still no movers. We called them back around 1pm. Was told they were still coming it would be another few hours. At this point we are upset but we wait, and wait and wait. I took another nap this time with my 17 month old who wasn't to thrilled about being in the house all day with boxes everywhere. We wake up around three. Still no movers. My husband calls. It was a little before 4pm. He was told "the guys are finishing up a job now and they are headed your way". My husband asked what time can we expect them? He was told "between 5p and 6p". At this point we wait and wait and wait. 5:55p, NO MOVERS, NO CALL! My husband calls back, NO ANSWER!!!! Calls again and again and again. NO ANSWER. Around 6:10p the rain starts and it doesnt stop. It's heavy rain. 6:20p driver calls. Here is our conversation:
Driver: We are headed your way
Me: Sir it's raining, like really raining. Isn't our stuff going to get wet??
Driver: Yes Mam it is. Even if we use the pads they will get wet and then sit on your stuff.
Me: I feel like I have no choice
Driver: What do you want to do? Do you want us to head that way?
Me: I don't know
Driver: Mam we haven't eaten all day and we would like to see our families before 11pm.
Me: Well why don't you all stop and get something to eat and maybe the rain will stop by then.
Driver: Mam we don't get paid to eat
Me: (Mouth drops), I'll just cancel.
Driver: Ok call Chris
Me: Who is Chris? Do you ha.....
Driver: Click up (He hangs up on me)

This all happened before anyone physically came to move our stuff.

name: GOAT LKMONEY
text: Great Experience And Very Helpful.

name: Matt Johnson
text:
I'm rating this experience as being "ok".  I've used 2 different moving companies in the last year, All My Sons and 2 Men & A Truck. In short, I'll likely be using 2 Men going forward because it was just a better experience overall and worth the difference in rate per mover.

Positives: The All My Sons (AMS) hourly rate, per mover, is far less than the competition in the field. Their sales staff is persistent in booking orders (which I like - some don't). They call a lot to check in and see what they can do to help. The movers didn't really sit around; they moved with purpose most of the time. The movers were very nice and did everything they could to provide good service.

Negatives: We were scheduled for 8-8:30am arrival; they didn't show up until 10:30am. Furthermore, I had to be the one to call to find out why they were late (had to call 3 times). The operations gentleman/rep that I talked to about their delayed arrival was straight forward but more in the sense of being border line rude. Just my opinion at that time; and I'll admit I was heated & mad having to call 3 times so the rep could have been nice the whole time but I wasn't truly listening...the underlying issue had something to do with the moving truck needing gas and their gas card limit was too small for what the moving truck needed; getting approval for the gas was what created the delay. Ultimately, the ops office set up the movers for failure.

Moot Points: I don't know that the movers were properly prepared for my move. I don't know if I did a poor job of describing what's going to be moved, or if AMS didn't communicate to the moving team.

Bottom Line: I needed a moving company to move items. AMS did that. I wasn't blown away by their service.

resp.text: Matt, Thank you for your valuable feedback, we are sorry we did not meet your expectation on your relocation with us. Please contact our customer care team at 866-941-1849. Best Regards, All My Sons

name: Gee Phil

They were also absolutely methodical about carefully padding, and packaging our fragile belongings in such a way that absolutely nothing was damaged or broken during our out-of-state move, even though the drive was nearly 10 hours for the moving truck. Dwaine and his team were also very accommodating and flexible regarding couple of unorthodox requests we made. They were both efficient and exacting in how they handled our loading and unloading and everything was completed in a timely manner. Dwaine drove our truck, and managed our move (and his team) in a way that created a stress-free environment for us and though this was the farthest we've ever had to move, because of Dwaine, it was the best move we've ever done. They were excellent!

Request Dwaine and his team if you use All My Sons Moving and Storage.

name: Stephanie Soars
text: Motivated Movers has the worst, most incompetent movers I have ever used. Friday (March 29) they were not only 30 min late outside the time frame given but my couch, coffee table, and interior of my home were destroyed due to just plain stupidity.  The movers shoved the couch through the hall until it was wedged between both walls. They then continued to force it through leading into the destruction of not only my couch but my walls, crown molding, and a door knob (breaking it completely off). I had to step in not only to direct these “professionals” on how to free the couch but also physically assist in moving it. I am awaiting to hear from Tyler, the manager, in hopes this company will redeem themselves.

name: paul davis
text: I needed about 16 large items moved into storage and my apartment.  They called to confirm my appointment, arrived on time, and worked quickly.  Andy and David did a great job. I'd use them again and recommend them to my friends.

name: Mrs. Lambert
text:
There are pros and cons with these"Motivated Movers"
There is a 2 hour minimum and that is reasonable- but they left without letting us know face to face, I mean, we were all right there together but they put the last piece of furniture in the truck and then drove off-- didn't even tell us that they were going to drive off after they loaded it....that would have been nice. After contacting them by phone,
They went to get something to drink........ and stayed there. Pulled  in the parking lot and stayed for over 30 minutes and then drove to the destination.  driving time is
$ 55.00 to and from, so that's a flat rate but pulling over for 30 minutes I thought was unprofessional and padding the bill not the furniture. So I was charged 2.5 hours instead of 2 and that was wrong. I would have tipped these Jokers because they did move in a motivated fashion I thought however that bill thing was shady.

text: They did a great job. They moved me with 2 trucks 4 men from Spanish Fort to ft Walton beach. They were very professional and careful. I Would recommend them to anyone

name: Tralina Mobley
text:
I was NOT happy at all with Motivate Movers.
They ‘appear’ to be sincere and dedicated to your best interest but after it’s all said and done, and I sort through my boxes, all they did was rip us off. Not to mention they have really crappy, thin, terrible quality boxes that when stacked, crumble. Not to mention they aren’t packed properly. As I began to go through and unpack, I found breakables that hadn’t even been wrapped.
I was unable to be present when they arrived at my new location, but I left specific instructions that the boxes were to be stacked appropriately in the basement and the furniture was to be unloaded in the house and beds set up. I arrived two days later to discover most of the furniture was thrown in the basement, only one bed had been properly assembled and the boxes were unloaded on the 1st floor of a three floor townhouse without even walking space. Also my king size bed was left to “appear” assembled but when I began to look closer at it, it was only set together and all the screws were left in a pile under the bed itself. I cannot stress enough that if you select Motivated Movers, you will need to be present and watch their EVERY action because they do not have your best interest as their priority.

text:
Horrible! DO NOT USE - My 3bdrm apt was almost $800 for a move!!!

I had 3 unmotivated movers, who took a simple move and dragged it out from 830am-130pm.  1 overweight mover, and young guy who needed help moving every piece of furniture.

name: Army Veteran 88
text: We used motivated movers to move our four bedroom home from Spanish fort to orange beach. Guys came in a packed the day before, they were very professional took great care of our furniture. Packed and wrapped everything to make sure that it was all taken care of, when I talked to the manager when he came and looked at the move he showed me step by step how the process would work. The next day one the pack job the driver showed me also how they would pack everything on the truck and insured me that everything would be done right and packed with care. If anyone needs a great, professional and motivated company to move you I would highly suggest these guys because, they completed their job and did it with the upmost care and professionalism.

name: Michael Shaw
text: Hard working movers. When there moving

name: Shelly Mobley
text:
My family and I used them a few months ago on a significant move. One mover, Hubert, came a few days prior to moving, and made sure that everything was documented and had everything tagged and in a certain order so that it would be loaded/unloaded properly since we were moving from a 2 story house to a 3 story townhouse. We also had a friend living in one of the spare rooms, and they were NOT to load that room up, as he was moving the next day.

On the day of the move, Hubert came and began his tasks while the other young men followed suit. Around lunch time, a few more movers came and among them was a young man named Coy (or Cory?). He came in like a tornado, throwing things into boxes and ignoring everything Hubert said. I had to take my mother on an emergency pre-move run, and we went down the road for maybe 15 minutes. When we got back, not only was everything loaded up in the wrong order, but they had loaded our friend's things into the MIDDLE of the truck. (They literally all had "DO NOT LOAD" signs on them that could be seen from where we were standing) The Co(r)y guy was standing outside the truck as proud as could be. They said it would take an extra hour or so to take that furniture back off.

Fast forward to when we were unpacking, I found some precious gifts given to me just thrown in a box, shattered. Many of my mother's dishes were beyond repair either broken or shattered, some boxes that were stacked collapsed on the bottom. There's so many more grievances I have with them, but these are the lowlights of our experience with them. I would NOT recommend them!!!!

name: Jenn M
text: Ricky and Dre did a great job and were very professional. I highly recommend these guys and would use them again.

name: Victoria Jones
text: the three guys who moved us were outstanding! Worked hard to get us moved in great time. Very professional. I’m giving such a low score because we had two trucks. One was a motivated movers truck one was a rented Penske truck. We get to unpacking and a few of my boxes were soaked. Unpacked sons crib bedding and felt wet but I just figured it was the humidity. Got to my plastic containers and there was an inch of water in it. This resulted in my child’s school pictures, awards, artwork being ruined. These were inside of plastic ziplock bags inside of plastic containers. Also had a lamp broken in half and a few China dishes. But the school stuff can’t be replaced. Child’s hand prints from preschool. That child is now in 5 th grade. I reached out to Motivated Movers they in turn forwarded me to the manager from our location. He called and told my husband he would call back after the holiday weekend. Two weeks have gone by we’ve tried to reach out again and still no response. It’s gut wrenching those things money can’t fix or replace but if you say you’re going to call back and fix the issue then do so. Integrity goes along way for a business.

name: Edwin Whiteway
text: My experience with motivated movers,moving from Huntsville, to mobile, Alabama, was reasonably good. I would recommend them.

name: Lane Riley
text: Very nice and friendly

name: Kered Yelsaeb
text:
My experience with Motivated Movers in Daphne has been mediocre at best. I've dealt with MANY moving companies over the years and while they aren't the worst I've dealt with (Allied...AWFUL) they weren't as professional as I'd like to see. They've moved items for me on two different occasions. The first time they moved some items from my house to a storage unit. In the process, they damaged my piano. To this day, they haven't repaired it.

Due to a lack of variety/choices when it comes to movers in this area, I decided they were the best option for a more significant move about a year later. I figured I'd give them another shot. It started off on a sour note, when they showed up nearly 2 hours later than the time we agreed upon for the start of the move. During the process, some of our antique furniture was damaged because it wasn't padded the way we requested.

Finally, after paying for the move with a check I was informed that they'd LOST it later that afternoon. This required me to place a stop payment on the original check and potentially compromised my sensitive account and personal information. I requested compensation for this mishap and the manager agreed to reimburse a small portion of the move and to cover the cost of the stop payment.

Overall, I have dealt with MANY more professional companies. The problem is, when you live in a small town like Daphne, AL the competition is few and far between and there is less effort to provide exemplary service. Honestly, if there were other options I'd look elsewhere. Unfortunately, based on what I've researched...they are the best you are going to get short of doing it yourself with a U-Haul.

name: Linda Thompson
text: Hubert and David arrived on time, were courteous and pleasant, and worked very hard to ease the pain of moving for my husband and me!

name: Char G
text: We moved literally up the road within 2 miles radius on the same highway.  They charged us over $1,300.00.  We moved from 3 bedroom apartment into 4 bed home but we have yet to purachse furniture for the room.  The couches were already at new home in boxes as my husband bought them and unloaded them with a friend night prior to move.  They moved like snails, sat in toilet for a while, took a long lunch, went and got a drink disappearing for a while. I had drinks out for them too as well as feed them lunch.  We were shocked.  They ruined our stainless steel side by side fridge.  We would never recommend this company, they rip you off take advantage of people.  Please read the other negative reviews and stay far away from this company.

name: Chris Jones
text:
The former manager, also named Chris Jones, was at my doorstep within 3 minutes due to an emergency move. I expected 2 guys but it was just him and his pickup truck. At first I was mad, but then the first piece he moved was an 17th Century French Armoire that weighed 673 lbs by himself. Needless to say, I was impressed. I was even more surprised when he picked up my king size mattress and carried down the spiral staircase without touching anything. But when he took his shirt off to pack the kitchen, I knew he was good. He must’ve been doing it a long time due to his chiseled physique and bulging muscles. Anyone who got him as your mover, was extremely lucky. Will use again.
On a more serious note, the lady ( k8lusterio )
That tried to say I gave her a bad estimate. I remember you. First off, in 99.9% of cases, it’s twice as fast to carry boxes than to dolly them. The dolly is for lazy people who don’t want to work. Secondly, you had more stuff than would fit on one truck, which means you were not truthful about how much stuff you had to move. NEVER, would I have given a 5 hour estimate on a job that was going to be more than one truck. Especially going from Daphne to Mobile. It’s like this, most people were happy with us when I was there, and most are satisfied now. However, in my 15 years of moving I have learned that when people CALL to get an estimate, a small minority will not be forthcoming with what they have, hence they get a low ball estimate so when the bill comes they will try not to pay, or remind you of the estimate. Things that impact your price on a move.
1. Be honest with what you’re really moving
2. Get as close to an accurate count of boxes as you can. That’s a big one. Some people guess 25, and they really have 125. Boxes take more time than furniture.
3. Be honest about access. Don’t tell the estimator that your driveway is nice and flat and no stairs into the house, then they get there and it’s a steep drive they can’t even get up with 8 stairs going into the house. Or it’s a winding driveway that really needs a 14 ft truck instead of a 24ft so it can maneuver and not get off in your grass.
4. Move as much of the little stuff as possible. The big furniture is easy and fast to move.
5. List any difficult pieces you know your prior movers had a hard time with. Or if special tools are needed. Mostly they will show up with a Phillips, flathead, pliers, and Allen wrenches. Some guys have more, but you can generally take down a house and put it back up with those tools.
Like I said, most people are satisfied, there is a small minority that you will never please. That’s true in any field you choose, but especially moving. It’s not cheap to move, and it’s definitely not cheap to own a moving company. Trucks are expensive, pads, dollies, insurance. You don’t want movers making $8 hr, or you will get $8 hr movers. So most of the companies pay relatively well. And chances are, whatever moving company you choose, you will end up with movers that used to work for the company you’ve been complaining about. Moving company employees are a lot like servers in the food industry. You sort of get stuck in the job and bounce around from moving company to moving company depending on management and who’s paying more per hr. Motivated has the longest tenured people that you’ll find of any moving company. In the end, go with your gut. DO NOT go with someone just because they are cheaper. Remember, $5 extra an hour may just get you some really experienced movers that can get you done faster and save you money over the cheaper labor that may drag the job out.
I miss my time in this industry, sort of. I loved helping people in that kind of stressful time and 95% of the time they were ecstatic because we worked hard and fast to save them money.
Good luck to anyone moving. You will not go wrong with Motivated Movers.

name: Daya Naef
text:
Thank you again for the 4th move you have completed for us.  Everything went great.  In the future for any moving service you will be the one we call.
Thanks again,  Judy and Daya Naef

name: Nadia Mohandessi
text:
Motivated Movers was hired by my ex-husband to move the remainder of his things out of my home in January. It is now late April. In the process, the movers crushed the doorframe to my back door. They acknowledged the damage at the time, took pictures, and said to send their manager an estimate from my contractor in order to get the damage fixed.

I have called, left voicemails, used Facebook messenger, and emailed this company repeatedly since then in order to get the damage repaired. I have spoken to a few people on the phone who promised me that the owner would personally return my call the next day. Needless to say, this has not happened.

I called today, as I have every day this week, and someone actually answered the phone. The person on the phone, a professional representing this company, HUNG UP ON ME upon hearing my name.

Please consider my personal experience when deciding on moving companies in lower Alabama.

name: JH SULLIVAN
text: This company was able to assist us on short notice.  I called on I think a Wednesday, and they helped us Saturday late afternoon when they could fit us in.  I am always impressed by employees who are upbeat with each other and understand their own flow like these three guys did.  Ours was not a complex job, no packing to do by them.  Just shift about a 10x20 space of furniture from one location to another 10x20 space a few miles away.  They treated the job with the same top quality work we have received during corporate relocations!  The price was really reasonable.  They worked at a quick but safety conscious pace.  There was not so much as a scuff to any wall, door jamb, or any of our belongings.  The one detail they could do differently to bat 1,000 with us, would be a proactive call at the very front-end of our estimated service-time from the prior-jobsite with a revised E.T.A. They did IMMEDIATELY return our phonecall with a new E.T.A. when we called at about 15 minutes past our initial timeframe.  And they arrived well within time to accomplish all during daylight hours for us. So they still get a 5star rating.  Thanks guys.  We'll use Motivated Movers of Mobile down the road when we need y'all. J. H. SULLIVAN

name: Lauren Hardy
text: Corey and Micah were excellent! Thank you for making this move stress-free!

name: Judd Davis
text: Why yall tear up my friend's furniture and wall like that?

name: K8Lusterio
text: Chris Jones gave me an estimate for 5 hours, and the move took almost 8 hours, plus we had to leave behind 5 gorilla racks that didn't fit in the truck.  His 2 men showed up with no dolly because they said it had a flat tire.  I suggested that they should have someone bring them a working dolly while they started loading but that was somehow not possible although their office was not far from the old house. The time I was charged also included the time it took for them to stop by their office to pick up a working dolly and to fill up with gas on the trip from Daphne to Mobile.  This is considering that 2 days earlier, I had already moved on my own some of the items that were originally counted as part of the 5 hours (golf clubs/cart/rack and yard tools/rack) so this would've even out the fact that I added some moving boxes to the move (45 minutes when I timed them doing it without using a dolly).  Four hours from the start, his men were still at the old house where there were still the TV, treadmill, total gym and gorilla racks to load.  I was informed that the only way to fit the 5 gorilla racks was to disassemble them (which meant more time I have to pay for because they would also have to reassemble them at the destination).  Worst of all, I called Chris Jones to let him know of the situation but I got his voicemail so I left a message and asked for him to call back.  He never called back.   Thus, I'm a dissatisfied customer.

name: Jason Smolarek
text: After speaking with multiple moving companies, brokers, brokers who said they were the movers, I was getting a bit frustrated with the process.  Everyone had bad stories to say against the other and everyone I was speaking with had horrible reviews.  I then went on Thumbtack and requested quotes for movers, that's where I found About The Move.  I received a quote right away and a follow-up call from Tammy to go through all of the items being moved to give me a very good estimate.  I really liked that the pricing was hourly based as opposed to how many boxes and truck capacity I was using.  The real deciding factor for me was that I would have the same crew loading my items, driving them to my destination, and unloading them - also, that my items would not be mixed with any other household's belongings on the truck.  Tammy worked with me through the booking process and even gave me options to move my date based on last-minute changes if we needed to.  JR and Sunshine did an impeccable job!  They were polite and professional and really went above and beyond to ensure the safety of my items as well as having to lift part of my sectional couch over the backyard fence to get it out of the house.  When arriving to our new house 405 miles away, they worked quickly and professionally ensuring that all items that were disassembled were put back together and set up just how they found them.  I really cannot say enough good things about this company.  The pricing estimate was on-point and straightforward with no extra/unexpected fees.  They collected a small deposit prior to the move to hold my spot and I was able to complete the final payment via credit card after everything had been delivered to my new house and I was satisfied.  We moved from Destin, FL to Tampa, FL and everything was complete within a 24-hour period.  This company is a class act and I highly recommend them to anyone looking for reputable movers whether local or long-distance.  I will definitely call them again when I need movers.  Thank you!

name: Ramona C
text:
I moved from out of state & my scheduled unloaders decided they had no availability until mid-August. I only had the truck 5 business days without an extra charge.
I called About The Move on Thursday after calling four other companies uninterested in my dilema. About The Move fit me in on that Sunday Morning,  which was a lifesaver!! They called me 2 times to confirm on the days before the move-- which assured me they were really going to show up.
The movers were experienced,  very efficient and polite. They took time to point out & allow me to take pics of damaged items (damage was done due to improper loading of truck by a DIFFERENT company). The movers seemed very apologetic and concerned although the damage was not their fault.
The price and service were phenomenal.  I would recommend this company 100% hands down!! They are awesome 😊

name: Eloise Thomley
text: I was given a price by Josh at About the Move.  When the move was completed, he charged over $1,000 more than the quoted price.  Additionally, we were told they would show up at 10 a.m. and they did not come until 7 pm and did not finish until 10:15 pm. The movers, however, were great. I would get a firm price before conducting business.

resp.text: Thank you for complements on our movers... To explain again::  We came to load on day one, and thought we were wanted to leave due to customers being tired from long day loading three trucks and were unable to finish the load on first day. We informed customers we had moves booked for next day so needed to load everything while we were there day one. Next day had to do the best t moved that had been booked for awhile so didn’t get to come until later in the evening to finish loading. Not a quote but an estimate on time, and the time took about 5 hours (4 men 3 truck’s at $222 per hour) longer to complete entire move than anticipated, our apologies, in result of that the cost did increase by nearly $1000.00.  If you were happy with everything but the price I don’t think one star rating is fair for or three would be understandable. Thank you for allowing us to safely move you from Alabama to Georgia
